> 1. is_under_speed and is_over_speed are new api？ If yes，What version start supportting them?
> 
> 2. From now on we don't need the api of get_speed_tolerance, right?

Correct, they are new APIs. The default implementations have the same behavior as what previously existed in thermalctld and make use of `get_speed_tolerance` for backwards compatibility. `get_speed_tolerance` does not need to be implemented by vendors if they write custom implementations of `is_under_speed` and `is_over_speed`

This PR shows the default implementation, as well as the supported releases:

@Pterosaur can we extend the tests to cover the IP prefix list? Single IP prefixes and prefix lists are handled differently in syncd/SAI, so we must cover both cases with the tests.

@Pterosaur, if I understand correctly, the tests are working in the following way:
The DefaultAclGroupTest creates and binds the DEFAULT_ACL_GROUP and all other tests add rules to it to test the traffic.

There are 2 issues with this approach:

1) We cannot run a single test (since there is a necessary setup in the DefaultAclGroupTest).
2) The configuration doesn't follow the requirements.
From the https://github.com/sonic-net/DASH/blob/main/documentation/general/dash-sonic-hld.md#17-acl-requirements:

> 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 parse_prs.py parse_reviews.py pr_dump.sh User can add/remove rules in a group as long as it is not currently bound to an ENI
> 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 parse_prs.py parse_reviews.py pr_dump.sh It is not permitted to modify rules within a group that is currently bound to an ENI.

With the current approach, rules are added after the group is bound in the DefaultAclGroupTest.
